Overview: This is a hands on project-intensive immersive course aimed at senior-level undergraduates and graduate students to give them an in-depth experience in developing different layers of a cloud computing infrastructure including software defined networks, distributed runtime systems, network function virtualization, and application development.
Students should have completedCS 6210with a letter grade of A (or high B) or have taken an equivalent course elsewhere before taking this course.
Suggested Background Knowledge: Students should have completedCS 6210with a letter grade of A (or high B) or have taken an equivalent course elsewhere before taking this course.
Academic Integrity: All Georgia Tech students are expected to uphold theGeorgia Tech Academic Honor Code. This course may impose additional academic integrity stipulations; consult the official course documentation for more information.
